New Records: Dasun Shanaka's 20-ball fifty is the fastest by a Sri Lankan batsman in T20 international cricket history.
Kusal Mendis' 27-ball fifty is the third fastest for Sri Lanka in T20 internationals and the sixth fastest by a Sri Lankan batsman against India in T20Is.
Pathum Nissanka and Kusal Mendis set up the second highest first-wicket partnership for Sri Lanka against India in T20 internationals with 80 runs.
Dasun Shanaka and Chamika Karunaratne set up the record seventh-wicket partnership for Sri Lanka against India in T20 internationals with 68* runs.
Sri Lanka's 206 was their second highest score against India in T20 internationals.
Sri Lanka's 206 was the highest score by any team at Pune in T20Is.
Dasun Shanaka equalled the joint second most sixes hit in an innings for Sri Lanka in T20 internationals with 6 sixes.
Axar Patel equalled the 20-ball joint fifth fastest fifty for India in T20 internationals.
Axar Patel equalled the joint ninth most sixes hit in an innings for India in T20 internationals with 6 sixes.
Suryakumar Yadav and Axar Patel set up the record sixth-wicket partnership for India against Sri Lanka in T20 internationals with 91 runs.
Key Match Events: Dasun Shanaka scored an unbeaten 56 off 22 balls, including 6 sixes and 2 fours.
Kusal Mendis scored 52 off 31 balls, including 4 sixes and 3 fours.
Charith Asalanka scored 37 off 19 balls, including 4 sixes.
Umran Malik picked up 3 wickets for India.
Axar Patel scored 65 off 31 balls, including 6 sixes and 3 fours.
Suryakumar Yadav scored 51 off 36 balls, including 3 sixes and 3 fours.
Shivam Mavi scored 26 off 15 balls, including 2 sixes and 2 fours.
Dasun Shanaka, Kasun Rajitha, and Dilshan Madushanka each took 2 wickets for Sri Lanka.
Dasun Shanaka was named Player of the Match for his all-round performance, scoring 56 runs and taking 2 wickets.
